citation.title: Permafrost Soils Database for Northern Alaska 2014

onlineResource.name: Project website
onlineResource.description: Web page with detailed information about the resource.

resourceInfo.abstract: This database contains soil and permafrost stratigraphy for northern Alaska compiled from numerous project data files and reports. The Access Database has main data tables (tbl_) for site (environmental), soil stratigraphy, soil physical data, soil chemical data, soil radiocarbon dates, and vegetation cover. The Site data includes information of location, observers, geomorphology, topography, hydrology, soil summary characteristics, pH and EC, soil classification, and vegetation cover by species. Soil stratigraphy has information on soil texture and ground ice. Soil physical and chemical data includes lab data on bulk density, moisture, carbon, and nitrogen. The database has 38 reference tables (REF_) that have codes and descriptions for variables used in site, soil stratigraphy, and vegetation cover tables. Query tables (qry_) are used to link data tables and reference tables to display data with names instead of codes.

thesaurus.title: NASA/Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) Earth Science Keywords

properties.description: Area of interest: Northern Alaska, from the southern edge of the Brooks Range to the coast of the Beaufort Sea.

resourceInfo.supplementalInfo: The database has 39 reference tables (REF_) that have codes and descriptions for variables used in site, soil stratigraphy, and vegetation cover tables. The reference tables are grouped by Site, Soil, and Vegetation. When coding uses standard codes or terms, the sources are referenced. Tables can be viewed by selecting Tables in left side navigation pane. The database has 8 main data tables (tbl_) for data sources, site (environmental), soil stratigraphy, soil physical, soil chemical, soil C14 dates, vegetation structure, and vegetation cover. The data tables have widely varying levels of completeness depending on data source. The variables are described and units specified for each table; this metadata can be viewed by right clicking on a table and opening in Design View. Queries allow the linking of reference table names with site, soil, and vegetation tables. One query available displays the site information with the class names instead of codes. Forms are available for viewing data from the Data Sources table and for viewing a linked set of all data available from the Site, Stratigraphy, and Vegetation tables. Four subforms were created to display the data in the frm_Site Data Viewer with codes.

onlineResource.description: This WebMap displays landscape level data layers developed under collaborative funding that included North Slope Science Initiative (NSSI), the Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative (ALCC), the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation (NFWF), Bureau of Land Management (BLM) and US Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
